<@U0480NDB2B0> you can try this:
• Change “object-fit” to “contain” for the image so the logo doesn’t cut
• add ‘margin-left: -12px’ to the image
• and set a with to the div ‘kl-slider-testimonial__author-photo’
How can I copy the HubL parameters of a global module from one theme to a child theme? I created a child theme but the header and footer navigation links didn't transfer over.

I think your two answers are going to be “manually” or “change all of the relevant field defaults to match the parent theme’s current state,” unfortunately.

Global modules/partials in child themes not inheriting the field values of their parent fits under the umbrella of “feature, not a bug.”

If you’re wanting to keep values updated across multiple different sub-themes or sub-sites, you’re probably going to have the best luck turning to HubDB, assuming you’re working with a sufficient tier of Marketing Hub.
I was hoping there was something like "Copy as HubL" that you can do for sections when using developer mode in the DND editor.

Depending on how you’ve got things set up, you might be able to use the `pprint` filter in tandem with the `widget_data` object to output the relevant field values into HTML comments, but that unfortunately still won’t get you anything that’d function as a quick copy/paste.
thanks a lot man !! it worked.!! was kind of difficult because I don`t have a mac so I was needed to ask my partner if changes were reflected but now is done. Thanks

I’m getting a _very_ strange bug with field visibility — one of my style fields is creating duplicates of itself every time it hides and unhides. I’ve attached a video of this behavior in action, and I’ll reply to this with a snippet containing the relevant portion of my fields.json.

The Column Spacing field should only be visible when the Layout field is set to the value Grid. This is working as intended in the default state, as well as the first time the first time the Layout field is set to Grid. However, once it’s changed back to Stack, a “ghost” copy of the Column Spacing field is left behind. This “ghost” copy cannot be interacted with, and remains until the page is reloaded. Each *subsequent switch between the two Layout values adds an additional “ghost”,* eventually causing some very odd and unexpected layouts.

Has anyone else experienced this particular issue before? Does anyone have any idea what might be causing this behavior, or have any ideas as to how to work around it?
Here’s the JSON for the fields in the “layout” group. I can provide the entire fields.json file if anyone thinks the additional context would be helpful.
That's in my top 5 favorite HubSpot editor bugs.
